PAGE.TITLE: A mean field description for the 1D Ising model
PAGE.DESCRIPTION: The green line on the graph is the line $y=x$, while the red line is a plot of the equation we derived in the video on the mean field description of the Ising model: $$ \langle M \rangle = \tanh\left[ \beta ( H + 2J\langle M \rangle ) \right] $$ where $\langle M \rangle$ is the average magnetization per spin. The sliders allow you to adjust the strength of the applied magnetic field, $H$, which is expressed in units of $J$, and the inverse temperature, $\beta$, which is expressed in units of $\frac{J}{k_B T}$
